name: THE ENIGMA RANSOMWARE SURFACES
desc: Targets Russian-speaking victims. Appends the .enigma extension. Creates the enigma_encr.txt ransom note.

name: CRYPTXXX 2.0 EDITION
desc: Kaspersky\u2019s free decryptor defeated. Concatenates the .crypt extension. Ransom notes named after victim ID.

name: SHUJIN RANSOMWARE SPREADING IN CHINA
desc: Zeroes in on Chinese victims only. Very complex decryption routine. Uses the \u6587\u4ef6\u89e3\u5bc6\u5e2e\u52a9.txt ransom note.

name: GNL LOCKER (GERMAN NETHERLANDS LOCKER)
desc: Targets German and Dutch users. Adds the .locked extension. UNLOCK_FILES_INSTRUCTIONS.txt manual.

name: CRYPTOHITMAN, A JIGSAW RANSOMWARE SPINOFF
desc: Hitman video game themed. Appends the .porno extension and uses X-rated images on warning screen.

name: CRYPREN RANSOMWARE DISTRIBUTION UPTICK
desc: Uses the .encrypted extension and drops READ_THIS_TO_DECRYPT.html help manual. Decryptable for free.

name: PETYA RANSOMWARE GOES WITH THE MISCHA BUNDLE
desc: If the MBR-overwriting Petya fails to get admin privileges, it installs Mischa, a typical file-encrypting Trojan.

name: PETYA AND MISCHA COMBO AS PART OF A RAAS
desc: Ransomware-as-a-Service platform launched allowing crooks to spread Petya and Mischa on an affiliate basis.

name: CRYPTXXX 2.0 CRACKED
desc: Kaspersky Lab updated their free decryptor for CryptXXX ransomware, version 2.0 now covered.

name: 8LOCK8 RANSOMWARE DISCOVERED
desc: New sample. Adds the .8lock8 extension and creates READ_IT.txt ransom notes. Interaction over email.

name: SHADE RANSOMWARE UPDATE
desc: New variant of the Shade aka Troldesh ransomware uses the .da_vinci_code extension to stain locked files.

name: FREE DECRYPTOR FOR GHOSTCRYPT AVAILABLE
desc: GhostCrypt ransomware (.Z81928819 extension, READ_THIS_FILE.txt ransom note) decrypted by researchers.

name: SNSLOCKER HITS THE HEADLINES
desc: New strain. Leverages AES cipher, appends the .RSNSlocked extension and demands $300 worth of Bitcoin.

name: XORIST RANSOMWARE LINEAGE DECRYPTED
desc: Decryptor for the Xorist family released by Emsisoft. Requires one encrypted file and its original copy.

name: 777 RANSOMWARE FAIL
desc: Appends the ._[timestamp]_$[email]$.777 extension. Decrypted by Emsisoft\u2019s Fabian Wosar.

name: NEW ZYKLON LOCKER IN ROTATION
desc: A GNL Locker spinoff. Uses the .locked extension and drops UNLOCK_FILES_INSTRUCTIONS.html/txt manuals.

name: THE END OF TESLACRYPT: MASTER KEY RELEASED
desc: TeslaCrypt ransomware authors close the project and release the Master Decryption Key.

name: WEBSITE-ENCRYPTING RANSOMWARE
desc: New infection exploiting Drupal vulnerability. About 400 sites affected. Demands 1.4 BTC to decrypt content.

name: DMA LOCKER 4.0 DISCOVERED
desc: Doesn\u2019t modify filenames. Creates Cryptinfo.txt ransom manual and extorts 1.5 BTC.

name: CRYPTXXX UPDATED TO VERSION 3.0
desc: Crypto flaw patched. Kaspersky\u2019s decryptor no longer capable of restoring files.

name: TESLACRYPT DEVS RECOMMEND A RESEARCHER’S TOOL
desc: Crooks provide a link to expert-tailored decoder on Tor payment site for the defunct TeslaCrypt.

name: ODCODC: NEW RANSOMWARE ON THE TABLE
desc: File renaming format as follows: [attacker\u2019s_email]-[original_filename].odcodc. Not decryptable for free.

name: ZCRYPT SPREADS VIA USB AND NETWORK SHARES
desc: New one. Appends the .zcrypt string. Propagates over autorun.inf files on memory sticks and network drives.

name: ZYKLON RANSOMWARE SWITCHES TO APROPOS EXTENSION
desc: New Zyklon edition switches from the .locked extension to .zyklon string. No more changes made.

name: BADBLOCK IS ON THE BLOCK
desc: New BadBlock ransomware doesn\u2019t append any extension to files. Ransom size is 2 BTC.

name: INVISIBLE EMPIRE THEMED TROJAN
desc: Another Jigsaw ransomware version. Deletes files unless a victim pays up. Decryptable for free.

name: JOBCRYPTER UPDATE
desc: A modified variant of the JobCrypter ransomware discovered. Uses the .css extension.

name: JUICYLEMON RANSOMWARE DISCOVERED
desc: New sample telling victims to send email to support@juicylemon.biz for instructions. Demands 1000 Euros.

name: CRYPTXXX MORPHS INTO ULTRACRYPTER
desc: Multiple design tweaks of ransom notes and payment page. Decryptor now called UltraDeCrypter.

name: GOOD NEWS: BADBLOCK DECRYPTED
desc: The BadBlock strain, which cripples both data files and Windows EXEs, is decrypted courtesy of Emsisoft.

name: ANOTHER JIGSAW VARIANT EMERGES
desc: This descendant of the Jigsaw ransomware displays NSFW wallpaper and uses the .paybtc extension.

name: BLACK SHADES CRYPTER WANTS A SMALL RANSOM
desc: Targets English and Russian-speaking users, appends the .silent extension and demands $30.

name: HERBST RANSOMWARE TARGETING GERMAN USERS
desc: This sample uses symmetric AES cryptosystem, appends the .herbst extension to files and extorts $50.

name: RUSSIAN RANSOMWARE CALLED CRIPTOKOD
desc: Attacks Russian-speaking audience, adds the .criptokod extension to locked files. Decryptable for free.

name: MULTIPLE JIGSAW RANSOMWARE SPINOFFS DISCOVERED
desc: New Jigsaw variants use the .paymst, .payms, .pays, .paym, .paymrs, .payrms and .paymts extensions.

name: CRYSIS RANSOMWARE FAMILY EXPANDED
desc: Another Crysis ransomware offspring appends files with the .centurion_legion.aol.com.xtbl extension.

name: CRYSIS PLAGUE RUNS RAMPANT
desc: According to a research by ESET, the Crysis ransomware is gaining momentum with cybercrooks.

name: NEMUCOD TROJAN SCRAMBLES FILES USING PHP
desc: Researchers defeat a new iteration of the Nemucod ransomware that uses the .crypted extension.

name: CISCO CREATES A UNIVERSAL TESLACRYPT DECODER
desc: Cisco\u2019s Talos Group releases a tool that decrypts all known versions of the TeslaCrypt ransomware.

name: CRYPTXXX RANSOMWARE TWEAK
desc: New CryptXXX (UltraCrypter) version labels encrypted entries with the .cryptz extension.

name: APOCALYPSE RANSOMWARE DECRYPTED
desc: Emsisoft researcher tailors a decryptor for Apocalypse ransomware, which uses the .encrypted extension.

name: JAVASCRIPT-BASED RAA RANSOMWARE
desc: Built with JavaScript, the RAA ransomware (.locked extension) also installs the Pony password stealer.

name: FLOCKER ATTACKS ANDROID GADGETS
desc: The FLocker pest targets Android devices, including Smart TV, and extorts $200 worth of iTunes gift cards.

name: DED CRYPTOR BASED ON EDA2 PROOF-OF-CONCEPT
desc: Affixes the .ded extension to files, imposes email interaction with the attacker and demands 2 BTC.

name: JIGSAW OFFSPRING PAYS HOMAGE TO THE ANONYMOUS
desc: The Anonymous themed Jigsaw ransomware variant concatenates the .epic string to scrambled files.

name: DR.JIMBO@BK.RU RANSOMWARE SETS A DEADLINE
desc: Instructs victims to reach the devs via email within 48 hours otherwise threatens to erase files.

name: CRYPT38 RANSOMWARE WITH WEAK CRYPTO
desc: Targets Russian users, appends .crypt38 to files and asks for $15 in Rubles. Free decryptor released.

name: POTENTIALLY DECRYPTABLE CRYPTOSHOCKER
desc: New sample using AES algorithm and appending the .locked extension. Experts found a workaround.

name: LOCKY DISTRIBUTION BACKED BY NECURS BOTNET
desc: New Locky proliferation campaign discovered, leverages the Necurs botnet to generate harmful spam.

name: DECRYPTOR FOR APOCALYPSEVM RELEASED
desc: Researchers create a decryptor for ApocalypseVM ransomware that uses advanced anti-VM features.

name: RUSSIAN USERS TARGETED BY KOZY.JOZY PEST
desc: Uses asymmetric RSA crypto. Victims are instructed to email the attacker at kozy.jozy@yahoo.com.

name: CRYPTOROGER, A NEW SAMPLE OUT THERE
desc: Employs AES algo, uses the .crptrgr extension and creates !Where_are_my_files!.html ransom note.

name: CRYPTXXX ADDS RANDOMNESS TO THE MIX
desc: CryptXXX ransomware starts appending random 5-char extension to files instead of .crypz.

name: ZIMBRA RANSOMWARE ENCRYPTS EMAILS
desc: Python-based strain. Targets the Zimbra open-source email platform. Ransom amounts to 3 BTC.

name: NEW APOCALYPSE SPINOFF DISCOVERED AND DECRYPTED
desc: Appends the .SecureCrypted extension. Emsisoft Apocalypse Decryptor updated to restore files.

name: TOWERWEB@YANDEX.COM RANSOMWARE
desc: Tells victims to email the dev at towerweb@yandex.com for instructions. Demands $100 worth of Bitcoin.

name: KRATOSCRYPT, A HIDDEN TEAR SPINOFF
desc: Ransomware based on open-source educational code. Concatenates the .kratos extension to files.

name: BART RANSOMARE DOESN’T ACTUALLY UTILIZE CRYPTO
desc: Stores files in password-protected ZIP folder rather than encrypt them. Demands 3 BTC.

name: SATANA BOOTKIT IS DOUBLE TROUBLE
desc: Encrypts files and wreaks havoc with Master Boot Record. Displays a lock screen asking for 0.5 BTC.

name: THE DIDACTIC EDUCRYPT RANSOMWARE
desc: Locks victims\u2019 personal data but doesn\u2019t request a ransom. Decrypt password available in a hidden .txt file.

name: ZEPTO EDITION OF LOCKY RANSOMWARE
desc: New Locky variant appends the

name: MONEY-HUNGRY MICROCOP INFECTION
desc: Uses DES (Data Encryption Standard) and requests an astounding 48.48 BTC. Decrypted by analysts.

name: SHADE RANSOMWARE TWEAK
desc: New Shade iteration switches from using the .da_vinci_code to .Windows10 extension.

name: AVG DEVISES DECRYPTORS FOR SIX RANSOMWARE STRAINS
desc: The tools restore files scrambled by TeslaCrypt, Apocalypse, BadBlock, Crypt888, Legion, and SZFLocker.

name: UNLOCK92 RANSOMWARE
desc: Targerts Russian-speaking audience. Email for interaction: unlock92@india.com. Decryptable for free.

name: EMERGENCE OF WILDFIRE LOCKER
desc: A likely Zyklon copycat. Circulates mostly in the Netherlands and Belgium. Appends the .wflx extension.

name: ALFA RANSOMWARE DISCOVERED
desc: Alfa, aka Alpha, ransomware uses the .bin extension and appears to be created by Cerber devs.

name: NEW APOCALYPSE VARIANT DECRYPTED
desc: Emsisoft\u2019s decryptor now handles the .bleepYourFiles version of the Apocalypse ransomware.

name: ANOTHER CRYPTXXX RANSOMWARE UPDATE
desc: New edition creates README.html (.bmp, .txt) ransom notes and upsells a tool called \u201cMicrosoft Decryptor\u201d.

name: THE BUGGY CRYPTOFINANCIAL SPECIMEN
desc: Requests 0.2 BTC to unlock files but irreversibly deletes the data instead.

name: BITSTAK RANSOMWARE WITH WEAK CRYPTO
desc: Appends the .bitstak extension to scrambled files. Researcher named Michael Gillespie created a decryptor.

name: PIZZACRYPTS PROPAGATING VIA NEUTRINO EXPLOIT KIT
desc: Uses the .id-[unique_victim_id]-maestro@pizzacrypts.info extension to brand all encoded files.

name: THE PADCRYPT CAMPAIGN REVIVES
desc: Having stayed dormant for several months, the PadCrypt ransomware (.padcrypt extension) re-emerges.

name: UNLOCK92 ENCRYPTION ENHANCEMENTS
desc: New variant uses RSA-2048 cryptosystem, cannot be decrypted. Appends the .CCCRRRPPP extension.

name: A LAME CTB-LOCKER COPYCAT APPEARS
desc: Sample dubbed CTB-Faker moves files to a password-protected ZIP archive. Potentially crackable.

name: ODCODC RANSOMWARE FINALLY DEFEATED
desc: Researcher going by the handle BloodDolly came up with a method to decrypt ODCODC-encoded files.

name: NEW XORIST VERSION POSES AS CERBER
desc: Although this sample uses the .cerber extension, it\u2019s a mere copycat. Doesn\u2019t link to Tor decryptor page.

name: WILDFIRE LOCKER ON THE RISE
desc: According to OpenDNS, there is an upswing in WildFire Locker distribution via the Kelihos botnet.

name: LOW-COST STAMPADO RANSOMWARE FOR SALE
desc: Appends the .locked extension. Criminals can buy a copy on the dark web for as little as $39.

name: DECRYPTION KEYS GIVEAWAY BY CRYPTXXX DEVS
desc: For whatever reason, CryptXXX Tor payment sites provide free keys to decrypt .cryp1 and .crypz files.

name: PETYA RANSOMWARE UPDATED
desc: Petya authors improved their Salsa20 algo implementation to encrypt Master File Table more reliably.

name: CRYPTXXX BADLY CRIPPLES FILENAMES
desc: A fresh edition of CryptXXX replaces filenames with 32 hex characters and appends random extensions.

name: PYTHON-BASED HOLYCRYPT RANSOMWARE
desc: Written in Python, the HolyCrypt sample installs all components as a single Windows executable.

name: AUTOMATIC ODCODC DECRYPTOR RELEASED
desc: ODCODC ransomware victims can now use an automatic free decryptor. The infection\u2019s C&C server is dead.

name: AVG CRACKS THE BART RANSOMWARE
desc: Free recovery tool by AVG allows Bart ransomware victims to crack the ZIP archive password.

name: POWERWARE IS NOTHING BUT A LOCKY COPYCAT
desc: PowerWare ransomware masquerades itself as Locky. Decryptor available courtesy of Michael Gillespie.

name: STAMPADO RANSOMWARE DECRYPTED
desc: Emsisoft team member Fabian Wosar created a free decrypt tool for the relatively new Stampado pest.

name: CRYPMIC, A CRYPTXXX LOOKALIKE
desc: CrypMIC bears a strong resemblance to CryptXXX. Researchers provide a comparative review of the two.

name: SIMPLE_ENCODER APPENDS FILENAMES WITH A TILDE
desc: New sample. Uses the .~ file extension and creates _RECOVER_INSTRUCTIONS.ini ransom note.

name: THE NOMORERANSOM PROJECT GOES LIVE
desc: A true breakthrough in fighting ransomware. Created by law enforcement agencies and security companies.

name: CHIMERA RANSOMWARE DECRYPTION KEYS RELEASED
desc: Petya and Mischa ransomware authors publish about 3500 decryption keys for a strain called Chimera.

name: JANUS RAAS BECOMES OPEN TO WANNABE CRIMINALS
desc: Crooks behind Petya and Mischa make their Ransomware-as-a-Service platform available to the public.

name: THE SHORT-LIVED JAGER RANSOMWARE
desc: Incremental ransom size starting with $100 worth of Bitcoin. C&C server went down shortly after launch.

name: UYARI RANSOMWARE GOES AFTER TURKISH USERS
desc: Appends the .locked extension to scrambled items. Ransom notes in Turkish asking for 2 BTC.

name: JIGSAW FAMILY KEEPS EXPANDING
desc: \u201cWe Are Anonymous\u201d Jigsaw ransomware variant with a new warning background. Decryptable.

name: KASPERSKY’S DECRYPT TOOL UPDATED
desc: RakhniDecryptor solution by Kaspersky Lab decrypts Chimera-locked files with the keys previously leaked.

name: THE RAZY RANSOMWARE PREDICAMENT
desc: New strain, uses AES crypto and concatenates the .razy extension. Even the devs cannot decrypt files.

name: LOCKY VARIANT USES BOOBY-TRAPPED WSF ATTACHMENTS
desc: The Zepto version of Locky ransomware circulates via malware-tainted WSF email attachments.

name: SHINOLOCKER, A NEW PROOF-OF-CONCEPT
desc: Japanese researcher creates educational ransomware called ShinoLocker. Another controversial initiative.

name: ASTONISHING SURVEY RESULTS
desc: 50% of U.S. companies were targeted by ransomware in the past 12 months, Osterman Research reveals.

name: CERBER RANSOMWARE 2.0 RELEASED
desc: Switches to .cerber2 extension and uses a new desktop background. Ransom notes unaltered.

name: VENUS LOCKER, AN EDA2 SPINOFF
desc: The EDA2 PoC gave birth to a new real-world strain. Uses AES-256 standard and appends .venusf extension.

name: HITLER-RANSOMWARE DISCOVERED
desc: Buggy sample that deletes extensions rather than encrypt files. Demands a 25 Euros worth Vodafone card.

name: REKTLOCKER BASED ON EDUCATIONAL HIDDEN TEAR
desc: Uses open-source Hidden Tear code with some modifications. Appends files with the .rekt extension.

name: RANSOMWARE ON IOT DEVICES
desc: Researchers demonstrate a viable ransomware hitting thermostats at the DEFCON event.

name: SMRSS32 RANSOMWARE, A CRYPTOWALL COPYCAT
desc: Impostor pretending to be

name: PIZZACRYPTS AND JUICYLEMON DECRYPTED
desc: Ransomware analyst nicknamed BloodDolly creates a free decryptor for PizzaCrypts and JuicyLemon strains.

name: POKEMONGO TROJAN DROPS ARABIC RANSOM NOTES
desc: Appends the .locked extension. Creates a backdoor Windows user account (Hack3r) for future PC access.

name: TORRENTLOCKER TARGETS ITALIAN VICTIMS
desc: Aka Crypt0L0cker. Uses the .enc file extension. Infects computers via rogue energy bills sent over email.

name: THE SHARK RANSOMWARE-AS-A-SERVICE
desc: New RaaS platform that allows for extensive ransomware customization. Devs get 20% revenue cut.

name: CERBER RANSOMWARE DECRYPTION INITIATIVE
desc: Check Point

name: CERBER RAAS REVENUE UNCOVERED
desc: According to an investigative research, Cerver devs\u2019 annual revnue is on the order of $1 million.

name: NEW STRAIN TARGETING KOREAN VICTIMS
desc: Based on the educational Hidden Tear code. Apparent ties to the CripMIC ransomware discovered.

name: APOCALYPSE RANSOMWARE AUTHORS GET UPSET
desc: The crooks keep insulting Fabian Wosar who cracks every new edition of the pest.

name: CERBER DEVS PATCH FLAWS
desc: Threat actors behind Cerber ransomware make Check Point\u2019s automatic decryptor inefficient.

name: SMRSS32 RANSOMWARE DECRYPTED
desc: Researchers release a free decrypt tool for the Smrss32.exe ransomware.

name: FSOCIETY RANSOMWARE DISCOVERED
desc: An EDA2 spinoff. Sets a Mr. Robot TV series themed wallpaper with Fsociety hacking group logo.

name: BART RANSOMWARE SWITCHES TO REAL CRYPTO
desc: Starts to actually encrypt files and append the .bart extension rather than simply password-protect them.

name: DETOXCRYPTO MIMICKING POKEMONGO FOR WINDOWS
desc: Payload pretends to be PokemonGO game. Takes a screenshot of Windows screen for intimidation purpose.

name: ALMA LOCKER USES RANDOM 5-CHAR EXTENSION
desc: Distributed via RIG exploit kit. Uses Tor C&C server. Ransom of 1 BTC to be submitted during 5 days.

name: ANOTHER CTB-LOCKER LOOKALIKE SURFACES
desc: Another CTB-Locker copycat, uses a similar ransom note and color scheme. Demands 0.5 BTC.

name: THE PURGE MOVIE-THEMED GLOBE RANSOMWARE
desc: Desktop wallpaper styling pays homage to the Purge movies. Appends the .purge extension to files.

name: WILDFIRE LOCKER TAKEDOWN
desc: Dutch police and NHTCU agency seize WildFire Locker ransomware\u2019s C&C server. Free decryptor released.

name: ALMA LOCKER DECRYPTION OPTIONS
desc: According to PhishLabs, Alma Locker\u2019s private key can be obtained with network sniffer during the attack.

name: FANTOM RANSOMWARE RUNS A FAKE WINDOWS UPDATE
desc: New strain based on EDA2. Displays a bogus Windows update screen to obfuscate the encryption process.

name: DOMINO RANSOMWARE POSING AS KMSPICO
desc: Based on educational Hidden Tear code. Payload disguised as KMSPico Windows crack.

name: LOCKY SWITCHES TO DLL INSTALLER TO AVADE AV
desc: The Zepto alias of Locky ransomware begins leveraging a DLL installer rather than an executable to spread.

name: SMRSS32 RANSOMWARE USES U.S. ELECTION SPAM
desc: New Smrss32 spam campaign delivering files masqueraded as U.S. Election news.

name: THE SERPICO VERSION OF DETOXCRYPTO
desc: Targets uses in Serbia and Croatia. Doesn\u2019t modify filenames. Requests 50 EUR for decryption.

name: FAIRWARE RANSOMWARE, A THREAT TO LINUX USERS
desc: Adversaries compromise Linux servers, erase web folders and extort 2 BTC for recovery.

name: RAA RANSOMWARE APPEARS IN THE WILD
desc: Instructs victims to send email to raaconsult@mail2tor.com for decryption steps.

name: THE CURIOUS CASE OF FABIANSOMWARE
desc: Apocalypse ransomware devs name their new variant \u201cFabiansomware\u201d to insult researcher Fabian Wosar.

name: CERBER SWITCHES TO USING A NEW EXTENSION
desc: New edition of the Cerber ransomware concatenates the .cerber3 extension to locked files.

name: REDIS SERVERS HACKED TO INSTALL RANSOMWARE
desc: Crooks reportedly used insecure Redis servers to infect Linux machines with the Fairware ransomware.

name: STAMPADO STARTS SCRAMBLING FILENAMES
desc: New Stampado variant replaces filenames with hexadecimal chars and uses the .locked extension.

name: THE NULLBYTE RANSOMWARE FAIL
desc: Pretends to be a PokemonGO bot app. Demands 0.1 BTC. Decrypted by Michael Gillespie.

name: NEW CRYLOCKER IMPERSONATES A FAKE ORGANIZATION
desc: Acts on behalf of inexistent Central Security Treatment Organization. Appends the .cry extension

name: CRYLOCKER DETAILS REVEALED
desc: CryLocker propagates via Sundown exploit kit and sends victims\u2019 details to its C2 server over UDP.

name: LOCKY SWITCHES TO AUTOPILOT MODE
desc: New Locky samples go with built-in RSA keys and don\u2019t communicate with C&C servers.

name: NO ACTUAL CRYPTO BY THE RARVAULT RANSOMWARE
desc: Targets Russian users. Moves files to password-protected RAR archive, creates RarVault.htm ransom note.

name: KAWAIILOCKER GOES AFTER RUSSIAN-SPEAKING AUDIENCE
desc: Hits Russian victims. Creates \u201cHow Decrypt Files.txt\u201d ransom manual. Free decryptor released.

name: PHILADELPHIA RANSOMWARE SPOTTED IN THE WILD
desc: New Stampado version sold on the darknet for $400. Features a Mercy button.

name: FLYPER RANSOMWARE POPS UP
desc: Appends the .locked extension and requests 0.5 BTC. Attacker\u2019s email address is flyper01@sigaint.org.

name: PYTHON-BASED CRYPY THREAT
desc: Uses AES encryption, adds the .cry extension and drops README_FOR_DECRYPT.txt help file.

name: PHILADELPHIA RANSOMWARE DECRYPTED
desc: Emsisoft\u2019s Fabian Wosar creates a free decryptor for the Philadelphia pest.

name: CROOKS FORGE SUPPORT FOR THE HOMELESS
desc: New Crysis ransomware rips users off under the guise of helping the homeless.

name: NOOBCRYPT TURNS OUT TO BE A LAME SAMPLE
desc: New ransomware, uses the same set of crypto keys for all victims. Decryption keys published by analysts.

name: LOCKLOCK, ANOTHER EDA2 SPINOFF
desc: Leverages AES-256 algo, appends the .locklock extension to files and creates READ_ME.txt ransom note.

name: NEW RAAS CALLED ATOM
desc: Shark RaaS rebranded as the Atom Ransomware Affiliate Program. Available on the public Internet.

name: STAMPADO DECRYPTOR UPDATED
desc: Fabian Wosar releases a decrypt tool handling new variants of the Stampado ransomware.

name: LOCKY PERSEVERES WITH OFFLINE ENCRYPTION
desc: Locky ransomware\u2019s autopilot crypto gets improved to prevent AV detection.

name: STAMPADO ENCRYPTS WHAT’S ALREADY ENCRYPTED
desc: New version encrypts files that were locked by other ransomware strains, so it\u2019s double trouble.

name: RAZY RANSOMWARE MIMICKS JIGSAW WARNING STYLE
desc: Razy asks for 10 EUR worth PaySafeCard to unlock files. Ransom screen resembles one by Jigsaw ransomware.

name: FANTOM RANSOMWARE UPDATE
desc: New edition can encrypt data offline, similarly to Locky. Now targets network shares.

name: FENIXLOCKER AUTHOR SPAWNS LOVE NOTES
desc: FenixLocker ransomware dev found to leave the \u201cFenixIloveyou!!\u201d message in each encrypted file.

name: HDDCRYPTOR REWRITES MASTER BOOT RECORD
desc: A highly dangerous sample that locks victims out of their computers by overwriting MBR.

name: FENIXLOCKER DECRYPTED
desc: Emsisoft releases a free decrypt tool for FenixLocker, which adds secret mash notes to encrypted files.

name: FANTOM RANSOMWARE TWEAKS
desc: New iteration sets desktop wallpapers randomly and derives ransom size from payload name.

name: STAMPADO AND APOCALYPSE UPDATED AND CRACKED
desc: Fabian Wosar stays busy upsetting ransomware makers with his updated free decryptors.

name: LOCKY OPTS OUT OF OFFLINE-ONLY MODE
desc: New Locky samples switch back to using C&C infrastructure for encryption, according to Avira.

name: CERBER CIRCULATION GROWTH
desc: A major increase in Cerber ransomware distribution: daily infections reach 80,000.

name: CYBER SPLITTER VBS RANSOMWARE DISCOVERED
desc: Spotted by GData, Cyber SpLiTTer Vbs asks for 1 BTC but fails to actually encrypt any files.

name: UNBLOCKUPC RANSOMWARE SURFACES
desc: New sample, drops \u201cFiles encrypted.txt\u201d ransom manual and demands 0.18 BTC for decryption.

name: MARSJOKE, ONE MORE CTB-LOCKER COPYCAT
desc: Bears a strong resemblance to CTB-Locker. Mainly targets U.S. governmental and educational institutions.

name: NAGINI RANSOMWARE FOLLOWS POP CULTURE
desc: Warning screen contains an image of Lord Voldemort, an evil character from the Harry Potter films.

name: NEW HELP_DCFILE RANSOMWARE
desc: Named after ransom note help_dcfile.txt. Appends files with the .XXX extension.

name: THE DONALD TRUMP RANSOMWARE
desc: In-development sample with a photo of Donald Trump on the ransomware GUI.

name: LOCKY GIVES BIRTH TO A NEW .ODIN PERSONA
desc: New variant adds the .odin extension to files and creates _HOWDO_text.html/bmp ransom notes.

name: DXXD RANSOMWARE FINALLY CRACKED
desc: Michael Gillespie, aka @demonslay335, creates a decryptor for the DXXD ransom Trojan.

name: OPEN-SOURCE RANSOMWARE FOR LINUX
desc: New educational Linux ransomware called CryptoTrooper gets negative feedback from security community.

name: PRINCESS LOCKER WANTS TOO MUCH FOR DECRYPTION
desc: Decryptor page resembles Cerber\u2019s. The ransom is 3 BTC (about $2200), doubles after deadline.

name: AL-NAMROOD RANSOMWARE DECRYPTED
desc: Appends the .unavailable extension. Emsisoft creates an automatic decrypt tool for this sample.

name: RAZY RANSOMWARE EXPANDS ITS GEOGRAPHY
desc: New version targets German users. Extorts ransom in PaySafeCard. Deadline for payment is 72 hours.

name: KASPERSKY DISSECTS BRAZILIAN CYBERCRIME
desc: A write-up by Kaspersky analyzes Brazilian TeamXRat ransomware that targets enterprises and hospitals.

name: NUKE RANSOMWARE SPOTTED
desc: New one. Uses the AES standard and creates !!_RECOVERY_instructions _!!.html/txt ransom notes.

name: RANSOMWARE MAKER JOINS SECURITY FORUM
desc: Apocalypse ransomware dev starts posting on BleepingComputer forums to insult researcher Fabian Wosar.

name: KASPERSKY DECRYPTS MARSJOKE RANSOMWARE
desc: Kaspersky updated their RannohDecryptor solution to so that it can crack the MarsJoke ransomware.

name: TREND MICRO BEATS THE GLOBE RANSOMWARE
desc: The Trend Micro Ransomware File Decryptor tool is now capable of decoding the Globe ransomware.

name: EMSISOFT CREATES THEIR OWN DECRYPTOR FOR GLOBE
desc: The tool can crack the Blowfish cipher used by the Globe ransomware.

name: KILLERLOCKER USES A FRIGHTNING TACTIC
desc: The strain appends files with the .rip extension and displays an image of a spooky clown.

name: FSOCIETY LOCKER BETA VERSION DISCOVERED
desc: Concatenates the .realfsociety@sigaint.org.fsociety extension to files and drops fsociety.html ransom note.

name: CRYPTOLOCKER 5.1 BASED ON HIDDEN TEAR
desc: Another example of criminals abusing educational ransomware code. No in-the-wild propagation.

name: MAJOR CERBER RANSOMWARE UPDATE
desc: New variant adds a random 4-character extension and creates README.hta ransom note.

name: HADES LOCKER, A WILDFIRE LOCKER HEIR
desc: Hades Locker occupies the niche of WildFire Locker, which had been taken down by Dutch law enforcement.

name: THE GLOBE RANSOMWARE FAMILY REPLENISHED
desc: Globe devs release multiple new spinoffs appending the .encrypted, .raid10, and .globe extensions.

name: CZECH USERS ENDANGERED BY KOSTYA RANSOMWARE
desc: Appends the .kostya extension. The ransom of 2,000 CZK (about $78) doubles after 12 hours.

name: THE COMRADE CIRCLE RANSOMWARE
desc: Adds the .comrade extension to files and displays RESTORE-FILES![ID] ransom note.

name: ENIGMA RANSOMWARE UPDATE
desc: New edition appends the .1txt extension and leaves enigma_info.txt ransom manual.

name: DEADLY FOR A GOOD PURPOSE RANSOMWARE
desc: Uses AES-256 algo and requests a Bitcoin equivalent of $500. Configured to encrypt data in 2017.

name: VENISRANSOMWARE DISCOVERED
desc: Uses VenisRansom@protonmail.com for communication. Enables RDP and steals passwords.

name: FIRST RANSOMWARE WRITTEN IN THE GO LANGUAGE
desc: Detected as Trojan.Encoder.6491, it appends the .enc extension. Cracked by Doctor Web.

name: DXXD VERSION 2 DECRYPTED
desc: Researchers create a decryptor for the 2nd iteration of the DXXD Ransomware.

name: NUKE RANSOMWARE UPDATE
desc: New Nuke variant spotted in the wild. Concatenates the .nuclear55 extension to encoded files.

name: LOCKYDUMP TOOL RELEASED
desc: Cisco Talos create LockyDump, a data aggregate with configuration parameters of all Locky versions.

name: EXOTIC RANSOMWARE ENCRYPTS EXECUTABLES
desc: Dev\u2019s handle is EvilTwin. Encrypts all data on target computers, including executable files.

name: NEW DMALOCKER VERSION DECRYPTED
desc: Malwarebytes releases a tool that decrypts DMALocker\u2019s latest !XPTLOCK5.0 version.

name: NOOBCRYPT RANSOMWARE TWEAK
desc: NoobCrypt 2.0 demands $50. Attackers decided to stick with the ransomware name given by a researcher.

name: ANUBIS RANSOMWARE EMERGES
desc: Based on EDA2 ransomware. Appends the .coded extension, attacker\u2019s email is support.code@aol.com.

name: NEW SCREEN LOCKER SPOTTED
desc: Only locks one\u2019s screen without encrypting anything. Demands 10 EUR PaySafeCard to unlock.

name: 7EV3N RANSOMWARE DECRYPTOR RELEASED
desc: Malwarebytes researcher nicknamed \u201chasherezade\u201d contrives a free 7ev3n Ransomware decryptor.

name: RANSOM TROJAN POSING AS A CLICK ME GAME
desc: Obfuscates the encryption process with an amusing Click Me game.

name: JAPANLOCKER TARGETING WEBSITES
desc: PHP-based ransomware encrypts data on web servers. Appears to have Indonesian origin.

name: MBRFILTER COUNTERS DISK-ENCRYPTING THREATS
desc: MBRFilter tool by Cisco Talos blocks ransom Trojans that attempt to overwrite the Master Boot Record.

name: LOCK93 RANSOMWARE ASKS FOR RUSSIAN RUBLES
desc: Low-quality sample. Appends the .lock93 extension to files and requests 1000 RUR. Decryptable.

name: ANGRY DUCK RANSOMWARE IS HUNGRY FOR BTC
desc: Uses the .adk extension to brand affected files. Demands a huge ransom of 10 BTC.

name: N1N1N1 RANSOMWARE UPDATE
desc: The variant uses a different filemarker (999999) and leaves the \u201cdecrypt explanations.html\u201d ransom note.

name: LOCKY DEVS USE SOME BAD LANGUAGE
desc: New version appends files with the .shit extension and creates _WHAT_is.html/bmp recovery manuals.

name: CHANGES IN THE BART RANSOMWARE
desc: Now adds the .perl extension. Ransom notes are called recover.bmp and recover.txt.

name: THE THOR VARIANT OF LOCKY
desc: Concatenates the

name: A LOCKY COPYCAT WITH HUNGARIAN ROOTS
desc: Dubbed \u201cHucky\u201d (Hungarian Locky), the sample mimicks Locky\u2019s wallpaper and ransom notes.

name: RANSOMWARE IMPOSING A SURVEY
desc: An odd strain that asks victims to complete a sponsored survey before unlocking the computer.

name: CROOK TRIES TO SELL DECRYPT KEYS TO A RESEARCHER
desc: Emsisoft\u2019s Fabian Wosar declined \u201crealfs0ciety\u201d cyber gang\u2019s offer to buy their decrypt keys on the cheap.

name: ANOTHER LAME SCREEN LOCKER
desc: GData experts discover and defeat a screen locker that uses cuzimvirus@yahoo.com email for interaction.

name: ISSUES WITH THE CRYPTOWIRE PROOF-OF-CONCEPT
desc: One more educational ransomware, CryptoWire, gave rise to a real-world sample.

name: ONYX RANSOMWARE TARGETS GEORGIAN USERS
desc: Ransom message is written in Georgian. Warning screen contains an image of No-Face anime character.

name: THE OFFBEAT IFN643 RANSOMWARE
desc: Leaves the IFN643_Malware_Readme ransom note. Requests $1000 worth of Bitcoin.

name: THE BUGGY JACK.POT RANSOMWARE
desc: No mechanism to reach the attackers. Demands 3 BTC but provides a Litecoin address instead of Bitcoin.

name: MASTERBUSTER RANSOMWARE
desc: Based on EDA2 open-source project. Drops ransom note called CreatesReadThisFileImportant.txt.

name: SCREEN LOCKER CALLED RANSOMWARE 2.0 SPOTTED
desc: Does not encode any data but locks the screen instead. Demands 1 BTC otherwise threatens to delete files.

name: NEW SAMPLE USING !LOCKED#2.0 FILEMARKER
desc: Discovered by Michael Gillespie, aka @demonslay335. Malwarebytes analysts create a decryptor.

name: ALCATRAZ LOCKER DISCOVERED
desc: Appends the .alcatraz extension and leaves ransomed.html ransom note. Ransom size is 0.5 BTC.

name: CERBER NOW DISPLAYS VERSION NUMBER
desc: Cerber Ransomware devs start indicating version number in v4.1.0 and onward.

name: SMASH RANSOMWARE ISN’T MUCH OF AN ISSUE
desc: Displays a \u201cFile Kill Timer\u201d window with a funny image of Super Mushroom. Doesn\u2019t delete any files for real.

name: DUMMYLOCKER WITH HYBRID PROPERTIES
desc: Encrypts data and locks a victim\u2019s screen. Files are appended with the .dCrypt extension.

name: ZSCREENLOCKER VIRUS SUGGESTS BANNING ISLAM
desc: Having encrypted one\u2019s files, the zScreenLocker ransomware displays a \u201cBan Islam\u201d image.

name: NEW ENCRYPTOJJS RANSOMWARE
desc: Appends the .enc extension and creates \u201cHow to recover.enc.txt\u201d ransom note.

name: PAYDOS RANSOMWARE, AN OLD SCHOOL STRAIN
desc: Displays a ransom note within command prompt. Requests 0.33 BTC for the passcode to decrypt.

name: GREMIT RANSOMWARE EMERGING
desc: New one. Concatenates the .rnsmwr extension to encoded files.

name: RSA PUBLISHES AN ARTICLE ON CERBER 4.1.x
desc: Titled \u201cThe Evolution of Cerber\u2026 v4.1.x\u201d, the article dissects new versions of the ransomware.

name: CLOCK.WIN32.RANSOMWARE SPOTTED
desc: Doesn\u2019t encrypt any data, simply displays a lock screen. Demands $20 through PayPal.

name: CERBER 4.1.4 APPEARS
desc: Spreads via phishing emails with fake Word invoice attached. Version number indicated in ransom notes.

name: NOOBCRYPT RANSOMWARE UPDATE
desc: New version uses an expired build of C# obfuscator. Accepts random, including blank, unlock key input.

name: CERBERTEAR, A CERBER COPYCAT
desc: A variant of Hidden Tear proof-of-concept pretending to be the Cerber ransomware.

name: JIGSAW RANSOMWARE EDITION WITH FRENCH ROOTS
desc: Decryptable sample that affixes the .encrypted extension to files and leaves a ransom note in French.

name: FSOCIETY RANSOMWARE APPENDING .DLL EXTENSION
desc: Based on RemindMe ransomware. Uses .dll extension and drops DECRYPT_YOUR_FILES.html ransom note.

name: RANSOMWARE DISGUISED AS PAYSAFECARD GENERATOR
desc: Uses a fake PaySafeCard generator window to obfuscate file encryption. Prepends \u201c.cry_\u201d to extensions.

name: AIRACROP RANSOMWARE BY TEAMXRAT RING
desc: Appends the ._AiraCropEncrypted extension to files. Distributed by the TeamXRat cybercrime gang.

name: IRANSOM INFECTION KIT SOLD ONLINE
desc: The sample can be purchased on underground resources. Adds the .Locked extension to data entries.

name: THE HEIMDALL PHP RANSOMWARE
desc: A proof-of-concept written in PHP that targets web servers. Created by Brazilian researcher.

name: TELECRYPT RANSOMWARE DISCOVERED
desc: The sample leverages the Telegram communication protocol to interact with its C2 infrastructure.

name: FAIRYTALE-ISH SAMPLE TARGETING RUSSIAN USERS
desc: A new specimen using a popular Russian \u201cKolobok\u201d fairytale theme for the desktop background.

name: FAKE OPM BANK NOTIFICATIONS SPREADING LOCKY
desc: Spam emails disguised as alerts from U.S. Office of Personnel Management deliver Locky payloads.

name: CRYSIS RANSOMWARE DEVS RELEASE DECRYPT KEYS
desc: CrySiS ransomware authors set up a Pastebin page with Master Decryption Keys for their infection.

name: KARMA RANSOMWARE MIMICKING PC OPTIMIZATION
desc: New ransomware disguised as \u201cWindows-TuneUp\u201d app. Propagates over pay-per-install network.

name: PADCRYPT 3.0 AFFILIATE PLATFORM LAUNCHED
desc: The updated PadCrypt version 3.0 can now be distributed on a Ransomware-as-a-Service basis.

name: THE ANGELA MERKEL RANSOMWARE
desc: Displays a photo of Angela Merkel in the ransom notes. Asks for a BTC equivalent of 1200 EUR.

name: RANSOC SCREEN LOCKER’S PENALTY NOTICE
desc: Locks the desktop rather than encrypt files. Blackmails users with sensitive content found on their PCs.

name: CRYPTOLUCK SPREADING VIA AN EXPLOIT KIT
desc: CryptoLuck mimics the warning screen of

name: RANSOMWARE TARGETING JPG FILES ONLY
desc: Dubbed the \u201cDemo\u201d ransomware, this one only encodes JPGs and appends the .encrypted extension.

name: CROOK SEEKING RESEARCHER’S ASSISTANCE
desc: One of Apocalypse ransomware devs contacts Emsisoft\u2019s Fabian Wosar, asking for help with a code bug.

name: PCLOCK IN ROTATION AGAIN
desc: A CryptoLocker copycat. Returns after almost 2 years of inactivity. Demands 1 Bitcoin for decryption.

name: PRINCESS LOCKER DECRYPTOR IN DEVELOPMENT
desc: Researcher nicknamed \u2018hasherezade\u2019 gets close to cracking the Princess Locker ransomware.

name: GLOBE RANSOMWARE DECRYPTOR UPDATE
desc: Fabian Wosar releases a decryptor for Globe2 (.zendr4, .raid10, .blt, .globe, and .encrypted extensions).

name: LOCKY ARRIVES WITH PHONY FLASH PLAYER UPDATE
desc: A variant of the Locky ransomware found to be propagating via rogue Flash Player update sites.

name: .NET-BASED CRYPTON RANSOMWARE
desc: Uses a mix of RSA and AES algorithms to lock files and demands 0.2-2 Bitcoins for decryption.

name: NEW SHELLLOCKER RANSOM TROJAN
desc: One more sample coded with .NET programming language. Adds the .L0cked file extension.

name: THE DHARMA REINCARNATION OF CRYSIS
desc: Dharma ransomware is a new variant of the defunct CrySiS. Uses the .[email_address].dharma extension.

name: THE HELPFUL “ID RANSOMWARE” PROJECT
desc: The ID Ransomware service by MalwareHunterTeam now includes 238 ransomware strains.

name: CHIP RANSOMWARE SPREADING VIA RIG-E EK
desc: New sample called the CHIP ransomware relies on the RIG-E exploit kit for proliferation.

name: NEW DEADLY RANSOMWARE VARIANT APPEARS
desc: Corrupts victims\u2019 data and provides no way to restore them due to a buggy key saving routine.

name: TRICKY OBFUSCATION BY PADCRYPT 3.0
desc: Uses a rogue Visa Credit Card generator to camouflage payload execution.

name: LOCKY SPREADING VIA FACEBOOK SPAM
desc: Malicious .svg images sent via Facebook\u2019s instant messaging system install Nemucod Trojan and Locky.

name: CRYPT888 SETS A DEADLINE FOR PAYMENT
desc: New variant claims to delete the AES-256 key unless a ransom is sent within 36 hours. Decrypted by Avast.

name: AESIR VERSION OF THE LOCKY RANSOMWARE
desc: Appends the .aesir extension and leaves _[random_number]-INSTRUCTION.html/bmp ransom notes.

name: VINDOWS LOCKER IS NOT A MISSPELLING
desc: New ransomware telling victims to call a \u201cMicrosoft Support technician\u201d. Appends the .vindows extension.

name: PRINCESS LOCKER DECRYPTED
desc: Security analyst @hasherezade defeats Princess Locker\u2019s crypto and releases a decryption tool.

name: DECRYPTOR AVAILABLE FOR TELECRYPT
desc: Malwarebytes releases a free decryptor for Telecrypt ransomware, which uses Telegram\u2019s API.

name: MHT FILES DELIVERING LOCKY
desc: Cisco Talos spot a Locky spam wave delivering booby-trapped MHT email attachments.

name: THANKSGIVING RANSOMWARE
desc: New ransomware appears that displays an image of a turkey on its warning screen.

name: OZOZALOCKER IS NO BIG DEAL
desc: Uses the .Locked extension and Santa_helper@protonmail.com email for communication. Decryptor available.

name: LOCKY’S NEW ZZZZZ VARIANT
desc: Another edition of the Locky ransomware appending the .zzzzz extension to encrypted files.

name: CERBER RANSOMWARE 5.0 EMERGES
desc: Proliferates via RIG-V exploit kit and spam. Still appends a random 4-character extension.

name: ONE MORE HIDDEN TEAR SPINOFF IN ROTATION
desc: Based off of open-source Hidden Tear proof-of-concept. Uses a Jigsaw movie-themed background.

name: LOMIX RANSOMWARE USING CRYPTOWIRE’S CODE
desc: A byproduct of educational ransomware project called CryptoWire. Asks for a Bitcoin equivalent of $500.

name: COCKBLOCKER AKA RANSOMWAREDISPLAY
desc: Appears to be an in-development ransomware sample. Appends the .hannah extension to locked files.

name: CERBER’S RANSOM NOTE TWEAK
desc: New variant of the Cerber ransomware creates _README_.hta ransom notes.

name: NEW SCREEN LOCKER BEING DISTRIBUTED
desc: Claims to have found viruses and displays \u201cYour computer is locked!\u201d warning. Unlock password released.

name: CRYPTER RANSOMWARE TARGETING BRAZILIAN USERS
desc: Attack are isolated to Brazil. Renames files rather than encrypt them. Demands 1 Bitcoin for recovery.

name: A PRIMITIVE SCREEN LOCKER DISCOVERED
desc: Displays \u201cYour Windows Has Been Banned\u201d message. The unlock password is 123456.

name: THE UNUSUAL KANGAROO RANSOMWARE
desc: An Apocalypse ransomware spinoff. Encrypts files and displays a warning screen before Windows boots up.

name: VINDOWS LOCKER DECRYPTED
desc: Security researchers create a decryptor for Vindows Locker, which uses tech support scam tactic.

name: SAN FRANCISCO MUNI HIT BY RANSOMWARE
desc: HDDCryptor ransomware paralyzes San Francisco Municipal Transit Agency\u2019s IT infrastructure.

name: NEW RANSOMWARE BASED ON POWERSHELL
desc: This PowerShell-based sample uses the ps2exe script and overwrites the original files.

name: HTCRYPTOR HARNESSING HIDDEN TEAR CODE
desc: HTCryptor\u2019s code is based on open-source Hidden Tear ransomware. Tries to disable Windows firewall.

name: SFMTA DENIES DATA THEFT
desc: San Francisco Muni\u2019s officials deny allegations about corporate data being stolen by ransomware devs.

name: NMOREIRA RANSOMWARE CRACKED
desc: Emsisoft analyst Fabian Wosar creates a free decryptor for NMoreira/XPan ransomware.

name: RANSOMWARE ATTACKS A CANADIAN UNIVERSITY
desc: Unidentified rasomware sample compromises Carleton University in Canada, demanding 39 BTC.

name: JIGSAW RANSOMWARE’S NEW CAMOUFLAGE
desc: A new Jigsaw variant uses a phony Electrum Coin Adder app\u2019s GUI to mask the ransomware installation.

name: ZETA RANSOMWARE STAINING FILES WITH NEW EXTENSION
desc: New edition of the Zeta ransomware uses .rmd extension and # HELP_DECRYPT_YOUR_FILES #.txt ransom note.

name: TORRENTLOCKER UPDATE
desc: The latest version of TorrentLocker, aka Crypt0L0cker, appends files with 6 random characters.

name: PRINCESS LOCKER CHANGES TAKING EFFECT
desc: New iteration uses random extensions of 4-6 chars and !_HOW_TO_RESTORE_[random].txt ransom note.

name: MATRIX RANSOMWARE USING GNUPG
desc: This sample locks data using the free GnuPG implementation of OpenPGP cryptographic standard.

name: MORE FREE DECRYPTORS BY AVAST
desc: Avast releases 4 free decrypt tools for CrySiS, Globe, NoobCrypt and Alcatraz Locker ransomware strains.

name: ALPHA LOCKER FOR SALE ON DARKNET RESOURCES
desc: Wannabe crooks can purchase the new C# based Alpha Locker ransomware on underground forums for $65.

name: HIDDEN MESSAGE IN NMOREIRA/XPAN CODE
desc: Code of the updated ransomware contains a message to Fabian Wosar who cracked the previous version.

name: THE IN-DEV PHOENIX RANSOMWARE
desc: Based on the Hidden Tear POC. Appends the .R.i.P extension to files and drops Important!.txt ransom note.

name: PADCRYPT 3.1.2 GOES LIVE
desc: Version 3.1.2 of the PadCrypt ransomware is out. This build doesn\u2019t feature any noteworthy changes.

name: RANSOMWARE DEV ARRESTED IN RUSSIA
desc: The man nicknamed \u201cPornopoker\u201d is accused of creating and distributing Ransomlock.P police ransomware.

name: NEWEST NEMUCOD VARIANT CRACKED
desc: Emsisoft\u2019s Fabian Wosar creates a decrypt tool for the latest variant of the Nemucod ransomware.

name: NEW ITERATION OF THE APOCALYPSE RANSOMWARE
desc: The updated Apocalypse Trojan leaves *md5*.txt ransom note and a new extension with country code in it.

name: ANOTHER GLOBE RANSOMWARE VERSION IS OUT
desc: New sample. Adds the .8lock8 extension and creates READ_IT.txt ransom notes. Interaction over email.

name: SHADE/TROLDESH RANSOMWARE DISTRIBUTION TWEAK
desc: New Shade, aka Troldesh, ransomware variant (.no_more_ransom extension) uses the Kelihos botnet to spread.

name: NEW SCREEN LOCKER THAT DOESN’T FUNCTION RIGHT
desc: It\u2019s supposed to lock one\u2019s screen and encode files (.encrypted extension), but the crypto part doesn\u2019t work.

name: LOCKY STARTS USING THE .OSIRIS EXTENSION
desc: New Locky ransomware variant appends the

name: GOLDENEYE RANSOMWARE, A PETYA HEIR
desc: Affects master boot record (MBR) and encrypts master file table (MFT), thus completely blocking PCs.

name: NASTY MARKETING OF POPCORN TIME RANSOMWARE
desc: Victims are suggested to infect two more users and thereby get their decryption key free of charge.

name: JIGSAW VARIANT CALLED THE “HACKED” RANSOMWARE
desc: New Jigsaw ransomware build featuring \u201cHACKED\u201d logo. The ransom size starts at 0.25 BTC.

name: NEW SAMSAM RANSOMWARE SPOTTED
desc: Appends the .VforVendetta file extension and leaves 000-PLEASE-READ-WE-HELP.html ransom note.

name: EDA2/HIDDEN TEAR VARIANT FOR SALE
desc: A cybercrime ring made tweaks to open-source EDA2/Hidden Tear code, now selling it on the dark web.

name: CRYPTOWIRE POC GIVES BIRTH TO REAL THREATS
desc: Crooks use new proof-of-concept ransomware called CryptoWire to create Lomix and Ultralocker strains.

name: ULTRALOCKER, A CRYPTOWIRE SPINOFF
desc: Arrives at PCs with malicious Microsoft Wod documents. Demands a BTC equivalent of $1000 for decryption.

name: CYBER SPLITTER 2.0 DISCOVERED
desc: Cyber SpLiTTer Vbs ransomware version 2.0 is out. Based off of the Hidden Tear POC. Demands 0.5 BTC.

name: THE LOCKED-IN RANSOMWARE APPEARS
desc: Ransom notes are called RESTORE_CORUPTED_FILES.html. The payment deadline is set to 15 days.

name: CHIP RANSOMWARE UPDATE
desc: Now uses the .dale extension and leaves DALE_FILES.txt ransom note.

name: DEADLY_60 SCREEN LOCKER SPOTTED
desc: Uses an animated Matrix-style lock screen. Demands a Bitcoin equivalent of $400.

name: PADCRYPT UPDATED TO VERSION 3.1.5
desc: Other than the new version number, no significant differences from the previous edition.

name: M4N1F3STO VIRUS WITH LOW IMPACT
desc: Locks the screen and asks for 0.3 BTC. The unlock code is \u201csuckmydicknigga\u201d.

name: SAMAS RANSOMWARE GROUP EARNINGS REVEALED
desc: According to Palo Alto Networks, the Samas ring\u2019s profits in 2016 amounted to more than $450,000.

name: THE PORTUGUESE PAYDAY RANSOMWARE
desc: A Hidden Tear spinoff. Uses the .sexy extension and drops !!!!!ATEN\xc7\xc3O!!!!!.html ransom notes in Portuguese.

name: “YOU HAVE BEEN HACKED!!!” RANSOMWARE
desc: Appends the .Locked extension to encrypted files and demands 0.25 BTC. Steals passwords along the way.

name: NEW KRAKEN RANSOMWARE
desc: Renames files to base64 strings, adds the .kraken extension and creates _HELP_YOUR_FILES.html ransom notes.

name: “YOUR WINDOWS HAS BEEN BANNED” SCREEN LOCKER
desc: Claims to have banned a victim\u2019s PC for terms of use violations. The unlock code is \u201cnvidiagpuareshit\u201d.

name: CRYPTOMIX RANSOMWARE UPDATE
desc: Uses the .lesli extension. Ransom notes are called INSTRUCTION RESTORE FILE.txt.

name: LOCKED-IN RANSOMWARE DECRYPTED
desc: Michael Gillespie (@demonslay335) releases a free decryptor for the Locked-In ransomware.

name: NEW CERBER DISTRIBUTION TACTIC
desc: Cerber ransomware payload arrives with rogue credit card reports that dupe users into opening a Word attachment.

name: ANOTHER XORIST VARIANT DISCOVERED
desc: New edition of the Xorist ransomware appends the .antihacker2017 string to files. Decryptable for free.

name: GLOBE RANSOMWARE UPDATE
desc: The only tweak is the new unlockvt@india.com extension for mutilated files. Demands 1.5 Bitcoin.

name: CIA SPECIAL AGENT 767 TROJAN
desc: Clone of the M4N1F3STO screen locker using a new background. The unlock code is the same (see above).

name: NEW FENIXLOCKER VARIANT RELEASED
desc: Drops \u201cHelp to decrypt.txt\u201d ransom manual and provides thedon78@mail.com email address for payment directions.\n

name: KOOLOVA RANSOMWARE TARGETS ITALIAN USERS
desc: This sample is currently in development. Only scrambles data in the Test path on a targeted computer\u2019s desktop.

name: “NO MORE RANSOM” PROJECT ENGAGES NEW PARTNERS
desc: Bitdefender, Emsisoft, Trend Micro and Check Point are now on the team. 32 new decryptors added, too.

name: AD-SUPPORTED BANDACHOR TROJAN DISTRIBUTION
desc: New BandaChor ransomware spreads via malvertising on X-rated sites and an e-commerce web page.

name: CHRIS’ EXPERIMENTS OVER HIDDEN TEAR
desc: Researchers spotted an instance of tweaking the Hidden Tear code by a wannabe crook named Chris.

name: THE BUGGY CRYPTORIUM RANSOMWARE
desc: New sample using the .ENC extension. Simply renames files rather than encode them.

name: A GLOBE RANSOMWARE REPLICA
desc: Analysts discovered a Globe clone that appends the .crypt extension and leaves HOW_OPEN_FILES.hta note.

name: CERBER RANSOMWARE’S IP RANGE CHANGED
desc: According to MalwareHunterTeam, Cerber starts using several new IP ranges for UDP statistics.

name: GLOBE RANSOMWARE TWEAK
desc: The updated infection switches to using the rescuers@india.com email address for interaction with victims.

name: DHARMA RANSOMWARE UPDATE
desc: New Dharma edition instructs victims to reach the attacker via amagnus@india.com email address.

name: CRYPTOBLOCK RANSOMWARE IN DEVELOPMENT
desc: Researchers discover CryptoBlock strain whose ransom notes resemble Cerber\u2019s. No actual encryption yet.

name: ANDROID BANKING TROJANS EVOLVE
desc: New variants of Android banking malware turn out to accommodate ransomware properties.

name: RANSOMFREE TOOL COMBATS RANSOMWARE
desc: The RansomFree app by Cybereason detects and blocks over 40 widespread ransom Trojans.

name: APOCALYPSE RANSOMWARE TWEAK
desc: Creates *MD5*.txt ransom note and uses cryptcorp@inbox.ru for interacting with victims.

name: M4N1F3STO SCREEN LOCKER STARTS USING CRYPTO
desc: New edition of M4N1F3STO screen locker encrypts data along the way. Decryption routine is buggy.

name: MNS CRYPTOLOCKER SURFACES
desc: Leaves RESTORE_YOUR_FILES.txt ransom manual and uses alex.vas@dr.com email address for communication.

name: KASPERSKY’S RANNOHDECRYPTOR TOOL UPDATED
desc: RannohDecryptor now handles CryptXXX ransomware variants using the .crypt, .crypz and .cryp1 extensions.

name: NEW VARIANT OF SAMAS RANSOMWARE GOES LIVE
desc: Appends .theworldisyours extension and creates CHECK-IT-HELP-FILES.html ransom note.

name: NEW GO-BASED RANSOMWARE SAMPLE
desc: Written in Go, the strain uses .braincrypt extension and !!! HOW TO DECRYPT FILES !!!.txt ransom manual.

name: ENKRIPSIPC RANSOMWARE SPOTTED IN THE WILD
desc: Aka IDRANSOMv3, targets Indonesian users. Decrypted by Michael Gillespie (@demonslay335).

name: MANIFESTUS RANSOMWARE APPEARS
desc: Mimics a Windows update while encrypting data. Demands 0.2 BTC for decryption.

name: PROPOSALCRYPT IS UNDERWAY
desc: New sample. Appends the .crypted extension to files and asks for 1 BTC. Decrypted by Michael Gillespie.

name: PADLOCK SCREENLOCKER IS EASY TO GET AROUND
desc: Researchers found a way to defeat the PadLock screen locker. The unlock code is ajVr/G\\RJzoR

name: FREE-FREEDOM RANSOMWARE MADE BY A TEENAGER
desc: The alert by Free-freedom ransomware says it was coded by a 13-year-old boy. The unlock code is \u2018adam\u2019.

name: BLEEPINGCOMPUTER RELEASES A USEFUL TUTORIAL
desc: Researchers at BleepingComputer publish a comprehensive guide on ransomware protection.

name: CERBER RANSOMWARE CHANGES ITS TACTIC
desc: New Cerber edition doesn\u2019t delete Volume Shadow Copies and primarily targets Microsoft Office documents.

name: WINNIX CRYPTOR TEAM CAMPAIGN DISSECTED
desc: The Winnix Cryptor Team ransomware is executed on servers via a BAT file and uses GPG crypto.

name: CERBER OPTS FOR NEW IP RANGES FOR STATS
desc: Cerber starts using 115.22.15.0/27, 114.23.16.0/27, and 91.239.24.0/23 IP ranges for UDP statistics.

name: THE OBNOXIOUS GUSTER RANSOMWARE
desc: New sample. Alerts victims with an irritating warning screen and audio. Appends the .locked extension.

name: FREE-FREEDOM MORPHS INTO ROGA RANSOMWARE
desc: Coded by the already familiar Adam kid. Appends the .madebyadam extension. Decrypt password is \u2018adamdude9\u2019.

name: KOOLOVA RANSOMWARE WANTS TO TEACH YOU A LESSON
desc: New in-dev version of Koolova decrypts files for free if a victim reads a few articles about ransomware.

name: ONE MORE CRYPTOLOCKER COPYCAT
desc: Another sample calling itself CryptoLocker concatenates the .cryptolocker string to encrypted entries.

name: CERBER DEVS ARE IN HOLIDAY MOOD
desc: The bad guys are getting ready to celebrate. Several C2 domains used by Cerber have \u2018christmaas\u2019 in their URLs.

name: VENUS LOCKER UPDATE
desc: New variant of the Venus Locker ransomware demands 1 BTC and sets a deadline of 72 hours.

name: ALPHABET RANSOMWARE IS ON ITS WAY
desc: The sample is still a debug version, hence not fully functional. Provides the decrypt key for free at this point.

name: GLOBEIMPOSTER RANSOMWARE DEFEATED
desc: A Globe ransomware copycat using the .crypt extension and HOW_OPEN_FILES.hta ransom notes. Decrypted by Emsisoft.

name: DERIALOCK SCREEN LOCKER DISCOVERED
desc: Demands $30. Victims must contact \u201cArizonacode\u201d Skype user for payment steps. The code contains an \u201cunlock all\u201d command.

name: CERBER RANSOMWARE TWEAK
desc: The update has brought about new IP ranges for statistical purposes, as well as _[random]_README.hta/jpg ransom notes.

name: BADENCRIPT RANSOMWARE APPEARS
desc: Appends the .bript extension to mutilated files and leaves a recovery walkthrough called More.html.

name: NEW JIGSAW RANSOMWARE VERSION RELEASED
desc: The new .hush extension being added to files is the only change made to Jigsaw in the course of this update.

name: NMOREIRA RANSOMWARE DECRYPTOR UPDATED
desc: Emsisoft\u2019s Fabian Wosar makes changes to his NMoreira decryptor, which can now handle the .maktub extension variant.

name: ODCODC RANSOMWARE RE-EMERGES
desc: Creates HOW_TO_RESTORE_FILES.txt ransom note and uses the C-email-[attacker_email_address]-[filename].odcodc extension.

name: LG SMART TV TARGETED BY A SCREEN LOCKER
desc: Android ransomware attacks LG Smart TVs, generating an FBI-themed lock screen and asking for $500 to unlock.

name: ANOTHER COMMONPLACE SAMPLE GOES LIVE
desc: A new strain spotted that appends the -opentoyou@india.com extension to files and drops !!!.txt ransom note.

name: KILLDISK MALWARE GETS NASTIER
desc: The file-deleting virus called KillDisk can now encode data. The ransom amounts to hundreds of Bitcoins.

name: ROGUE ANTIVIRUS INSTALLER SPREADS RANSOMWARE
desc: A sample of the GoldenEye ransomware was found to proliferate via a bogus ESET AV installer.

name: DHARMA RANSOMWARE GOES WITH NEW RANSOM NOTES
desc: The mkgoro@india.com version of the Dharma ransomware uses HTA format for its ransom notes (Info.hta).

name: SAMAS INFECTION UNDERGOES A CHANGE
desc: New Samas ransomware iteration uses the .whereisyourfiles extension and WHERE-YOUR-FILES.html help file.

name: PROOF-OF-CONCEPT RANSOMWARE CRITICIZED
desc: An article posted on MalwareTech blog explains why open source ransomware is a bad idea.
